conbody.p: The Editor area is the largest window in the interface and it is where you create or modify diagrams to produce graphical models that represent business processes. The Editor area provides a flexible free-form layout that does not restrict how you construct your diagram, although a general left-to-right flow of elements is recommended. You can open more than one file at a time in the Editor area. The names of the opened files are shown as tabs across the top of the Editor area, which lets you easily switch between open files. Only one file, however, can be active (displayed or edited) at a time in the Editor area.
Tip To enlarge the Editor area to view or edit a large diagram, you can use the divider bars to resize the area.
The Editor area contains the following icons:

strow.stentry: Indicates an error in the properties of an element. If the properties of an element are incorrect or incomplete, this red x-shaped icon is displayed in the diagram near the element. Detailed text information about the error is also available in the Problems tab of the Properties view pane. The icon disappears when the required information is completed.
